channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Operation Rainbow Space Baby: An astronaut's journey with IVF
item.description: Struggling to have a second child, astronaut Kellie Gerardi uses her social media presence to let others know they're not alone.

item.title: Steel tariffs double. And, Congress asked to eliminate public broadcasting funds
item.description: Tariffs on imported steel and aluminum are doubling today. Here's how it could impact your wallets. And, Trump has asked Congress to wipe out funding ...

item.title: To get from experience to emotion, the brain hits 'sustain'
item.description: A study of mice and people looks at how the brain takes an experience, like being cut off in traffic, and responds with an emotion, like road rage.

item.title: Deadly Aid Deliveries in Gaza
item.description: Israel’s troops have repeatedly shot near food distribution sites.

item.title: Edmund White, Pioneer of Queer Literature, Is Dead at 85
item.description: He mined his own varied catalog of sexual experiences in more than 30 books of fiction and nonfiction.

item.title: Greetings from Mexico City, where these dogs ride a bus to and from school
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international correspondents share snapshots of moments from their lives and work around the wor...

item.title: At Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial, Video Expert Testifies About Hotel Footage of Abuse
item.description: Later on Wednesday, a friend of Sean Combs’s former girlfriend Casandra Ventura is set to give her account of being dangled from a 17th-floor balcony.

item.title: Making the case for housing as a human right
item.description: And Housing for All is an impressively comprehensive examination of homelessness in America by Maria Foscarinis, who has worked in homelessness advoca...

item.title: Drone Attacks Are the New Front in War. Can NATO Keep Up?
item.description: Assaults in Russia and Ukraine have shown major military powers that they are unprepared for evolving forms of warfare, and need to adapt.

item.title: Germans Are Buying More Electric Cars, but Not Teslas
item.description: Drivers in the country, Europe’s largest car market, are avoiding vehicles from Tesla, which has seen a drop in sales in other countries as well.

item.title: Attack on Aid Convoy in Sudan Kills 5, U.N. Says
item.description: The delivery was supposed to be the first to arrive in the embattled city of El Fasher, the capital of North Darfur State, in more than a year.

item.title: Trump Budget Eliminates Funding for Crucial Global Vaccination Programs
item.description: The spending proposal terminates support of health programs that, according to the proposal, “do not make Americans safer.”

item.title: Ayatollah Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader, Calls U.S. Nuclear Deal Proposal ‘Nonsense’
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said that abandoning uranium enrichment would be against Iran’s interests.

item.title: Jury in El Salvador Convicts 3 Ex-Officers in 1982 Killings of Dutch Journalists
item.description: A jury convicted the former military officers for the murder of four Dutch television journalists who were covering the Salvadoran civil war.

item.title: Drone Attacks Are the New Front in War. Can NATO Keep Up?
item.description: Assaults in Russia and Ukraine have shown major military powers that they are unprepared for evolving forms of warfare, and need to adapt.
